data.name: Vrerience - Fear of Elevators
data.detailed_description: This simulation treats the Fear of Elevators as a claustrophobic problem. Claustrophobia is a fear of small spaces and/or being trapped in them. Many experience this fear as a suffocating sensation. The client can use touch controllers to push the elevator buttons and practice moving between floors. They can walk in and out of elevators either by walking in real life, or by using the touch controllers when physical space is too limited. The therapist can “break” and “fix” the elevator, stopping or restarting any of its movements or responsiveness. The top floor is the roof of a building overlooking a city.
data.about_the_game: This simulation treats the Fear of Elevators as a claustrophobic problem. Claustrophobia is a fear of small spaces and/or being trapped in them. Many experience this fear as a suffocating sensation. The client can use touch controllers to push the elevator buttons and practice moving between floors. They can walk in and out of elevators either by walking in real life, or by using the touch controllers when physical space is too limited. The therapist can “break” and “fix” the elevator, stopping or restarting any of its movements or responsiveness. The top floor is the roof of a building overlooking a city.
data.short_description: A VRERIENCE program meant for use in the professional treatment of clients with Fear of Elevators.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-4590 or AMD FX 8350
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 3GB Video RAM (e.g. GeForce GTX 1060 3GB)
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 300 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Oculus Rift/S + Touch required
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i7 9700K 3.6GHz or AMD Ryzen 7 2700X
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 6GB Video RAM (e.g. GeForce GTX 1060 6GB)
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Oculus Rift/S + Touch required
